name: Semantic System Axiom
intent: Define the core structure of a semantic system as used throughout Meta-Genesis Volume II.
constraints: A semantic system S is a tuple (X, C, δ, Φ, Π, ψ, A) where X is a state space, C is a configuration space, δ is a deviation operator, Φ is an interpretation operator, Π is an evaluation operator, ψ is a semantic wave operator, and A is an adjacency structure.
Every operator (δ, Φ, Π, ψ) must be well-typed: δ: C \-\> D, Φ: D \-\> R, Π: R \-\> O, ψ: R \-\> R, for some deviation space D, representation space R, and outcome space O.
The semantic system must admit at least one non-trivial semantic trajectory: the composite H \= Π ∘ Φ ∘ δ is not constant on C.
Adjacency A must define at least a pre-graph structure on R (or on a distinguished semantic unit set V), suitable for constructing a Laplacian Δ.
